document.docTitle: Syringophilopsis corvinae Skoracki & Sikora, 2003, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Quill mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Syringophilidae) from African passeriform birds

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Quill mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Syringophilidae) from African passeriform birds

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female holotype ,
6 female
paratypes from Yellow­billed Shrike
Corvinella corvina
( Passeriformes : Laniidae ); Cameroun , Galim,
14 August 1968
, leg. F. Puylaert ( 141.266 ). Holotype and paratypes are deposited in the MRAC except
1 female
paratype in the UAM .

Female (
Figs 5­8
).
Total body length 1200 in holotype ( 1155 in one paratype ).
Gnathosoma : Hypostomal
apex ornamented, two pairs of median protuberances present (
Fig 7
). Peritremes M­ shaped, each transverse branch with 5­6 chambers and each longitudinal branch with 10­13 chambers (
Fig. 8
). Stylophore 285 ( 295 ) long.
Idiosoma : Cuticular
striations as in figs 5, 6 . Propodosomal plate slightly concave on anterior and posterior margins, scarcely punctuated near bases of setae sci or without punctuations. All propodosomal setae except h , situated on this plate. Lengths of setae:
vi 60
( 70 ); ve ( 125­145 ); sci ( 395 ); h ( 420­455 ); sce 420 ( 410­470 );
d 1
420 ( 425­475 ). Two small poorly sclerotized hysterosomal plates present. Lengths of setae:
l 1
( 410­455 );
d 2
415 ;
l 2
( 410­455 ). Pygidial plate present, anterior margin indistinct. Setae
l 4
,
l 5
,
d 4
and
d 5
situated on this plate. Lengths of setae:
d 5
90 ( 90­95 );
d 4
( 120­145 );
ic 3
( 215­245 );
g 1
75 ( 90 );
g 2
75 ( 100 ); a 1 55 ( 40­55 ); a 2 40 ( 35 );
pg 1
( 345 );
pg 2
75 ( 90 ).

The name
corvinae
refers to the specific name of the host ­
Corvinella corvina

Syringophilopsis corvinae
sp. n. is most similar to
Syringophilopsis yosefi
Skoracki, Tryjanowski, Hromada, 2002
from
Lanius
sp. ( Laniidae ) by having the following characters: the setae
d 4
and
d 5
are short; hypostomal apices is with two pairs of median protuberances; pygidial plate is present; total body length is longer than 1000 . The new species is distinguishable from
S. yosefi
by the presence of following characters: In the female
S. corvinae
sp. n. propodosomal plate is slightly ornamented (
Fig. 9
); pygidial plate is concave on anterior margin (
Fig. 10
); distances between setal bases vi­vi and
sci­d 1
are 115­ 130 and 90­105 respectively (ratio
vi­vi:sci­d 1
is 1,2 : 1 ); distances between setal bases
1 c­ 1 c
,
2 c­ 2 c
and
1 c­ 2 c
are 125­140, 145 ­ 175 and 120­130 respectively (ratio
1 c­ 1 c: 1 c­ 2 c: 2 c­ 2 c
is 1,1 : 1 : 1,3 ); the epimeres I are fused to epimeres II at middle part of epimeres II (
Fig. 11
); the legs III are thick (
Fig. 12
) ­ the length of tarsus III is 46 ; the width of trochanter III is 41­48 ; ratio wide of trochanter III: length of trochanter III is 1 : 0,9­1,1 .

In the female
S. yosefi
( type material) propodosomal plate is strongly ornamented (
Fig. 13
); pygidial plate is convex on anterior margin (
Fig. 14
); distances between setal bases vivi and
sci­d 1
are 90­95 and 125­140 respectively (ratio
vi­vi:sci­d 1
is 1 : 1,4 ); distances between setal bases
1 c­ 1 c
,
2 c­ 2 c
and
1 c­ 2 c
are 90­95, 105 ­ 130 and 145­165 respectively (ratio
1 c­ 1 c: 1 c­ 2 c: 2 c­ 2 c
is 1 : 1,5­1,8 : 1,2­1,4 ); the epimeres I are fused to epimeres II at anterior part of epimeres II (
Fig. 15
); the legs III are thin (
Fig. 12
) ­ the length of tarsus III is 55­60 ; the width of trochanter III is 30 ; ratio wide of trochanter III: length of trochanter III is 1 : 1,5 .
